channel.title: Pls help: read this : npcs
channel.description:
How can I create Npcs who say something as well: pkgod is the owner or otherthings.
and where i must save that file and all the other things ;)

::Preparing for combile…
::Auto-setting envriomental variables
::
::Scanning for latest JDK version
::
::No version of JDK 1.6 was detected

but i have already Jdk downloaded and installed
but i dont no whats(::Auto-setting envriomental variables) mean

Read full topic

item.title: Pls help: read this : npcs
item.dc:creator: @Sp3ke Sp3ke
item.description:
@Sp3ke wrote:

Ok, I’ll spoon-feed you on exactly how to do it. I didn’t realize you also wanted to SPAWN the NPC.
Step 1 : - Spawning the NPC

To spawn an NPC you need to go to you’re autospawn.cfg file which is normally located in a folder called “config”. Once you’re in you’re autospawn.cfg file you should see something that looks like this :

spawn = 496		3090	3244	0	0	0	0	0
At the moment the first three numbers are the only thing that matters to you. The first number 496 is you're NPC ID, the second number 3090 is you're x-coordinate and you're third number 3244 is you're y-coordinate.

So what you need to do now is go to npc.cfg and first find the ID of the NPC you wish to spawn. Then you will need to change the x-and-y coordinates to suit you which can be done by typing ::mypos in game. (Assuming you have that command set)

Go to npchandler.java and search for “Randomwalk” and you will see this :

if (npcs[i].RandomWalk == true) { npcs[i].getNextNPCMovement(); }
Add this underneath is

if (npcs[i].npcType == ###) { if (misc.random2(^^) <= 2) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "%%%%%"; } }
Change the %%% to what you want the text to say and the ### is your npc ID.

^^ is the timer.

THEN SAVE COMPILE AND RUN

Read full topic
